website_summaries.verdict: The best value for users who want long-distance channel reception without spending a lot of money.
pros: Provides amplified reception and a 50-mile channel range at a value price
The easy setup and streamlined design is  comparable to costlier models
cons: The suction mounting does not work well on all surfaces
May not work as well if placed far from a window

customer_reviews.title: Great antenna
customer_reviews.text: This is a great antenna. I had one that I paid $40 for that worked pretty good. However it was cumbersome to deal with because it required 120 volts for the power supply. I bought this one because it didn't need an external power supply and is light and very easy to install. I get a lot more channels with this antenna than I did with the more expensive one. Works so good that I bought a second one for the TV in my other room.
customer_reviews.author: TC

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for me due to poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Didn't work well for me. Pieces flew off in the wind and not even a strong one at that. Wish that I hadn't purchased. I disposed of them shortly after buying. Purchased a very good quality antenna locally and it works great! I recommend that you do the same.
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: Different rooms will yield different results...GREAT picture quality
customer_reviews.text: This works perfectly in certain parts of my house, not so well in the family room which is just as close to a window as the other areas. The one thing that is a big drawback is it does not stay affixed to the wall -- it falls off every time I close the back door which is a decent distance away. In the bedroom I got about 34 channels and almost 50 in my study. You do have to play with the location to see what works best to get the maximum number of channels, so as such I strongly recommend to do an channel scan after placing it in at least two locations.
customer_reviews.author: Deevah

customer_reviews.title: Great product - works perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Could not be happier with the decision to cut cable FOREVER and buy this simple product. It delivers well. You have to be ready for a little trial and error with regard to direction of the unit but once set you should be good to go. Every now and then I have some reception issues but I think it is more due to placement and not due to the product. Do your homework, look online, you may need a different product based upon your location (urban versus rural) but if this is an option go for it.
customer_reviews.author: Fairfax Thunder

customer_reviews.title: What a price for a great product
customer_reviews.text: Not only did we get this product the next day but a lot of the channels that we never got before we get now and they come in really clear. My apartment even is made with cinder blocks and I get good reception I am unbiased reviewer and hardly ever write reviews but this product works really good and you really can't beat the price!
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: This thing works great! We stuck it to the wall behind our TV. You can't see it at all, and we now get 7 local channels plus ABC and some other major networks, for free. With that and Netflix & Hulu, what else do you need? We've had it for over a year now with no problems, except that the double-sided tape it comes with doesn't stick well. It's fallen off the wall a few times, but doesn't seem damaged at all. We just got better, thicker tape, and problem solved.
customer_reviews.author: M. Carter

customer_reviews.title: Terrible antenna
customer_reviews.text: I'm currently using an old Terk LOGTVO antenna about 1/3 the size of this one. I was hoping a much larger antenna like this would pull in my weaker stations a little better. Boy was I wrong. Not only did it not pull in my weak stations, but it couldn't even pull in the strong ones I was getting on my old, small antenna. I'm 40 miles from the towers, and this couldn't pull in a single station. Don't waste your time or money. Theis far better, but not designed for outdoor use. However, I don't see why it wouldn't work outside.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonian

customer_reviews.title: I need a little better reception to reach the vhf stations that I want
customer_reviews.text: This is a well made antenna and does the job well for most stations. I need a little better reception to reach the vhf stations that I want, example PBS. OETA in OKC, about 125 miles from me. I get it sometimes but signal is max of about 43%, Fox 18 is less than 55% in southern Oklahoma transmitted to Wichita Falls, TX, most other stations ar above 60-70% which is very good. My cables are long and suffer signal loss but the Antenna does very well especially with VHF stations where many suffer. For the price it is a great buy. However the shipping box was open on one end upon arrival, but all was there, not well packaged!
customer_reviews.author: Larry D.

customer_reviews.title: Works good, but check your VHF channels to make sure this one covers them.
customer_reviews.text: I can only like a piece of hardware with no moving parts. It comes in a kit, and is easy to assemble. It replaced my older UHF antenna. I got this because it also included some of the VHF channels that are in the new digital era but did not move to UHF. NOTE ! Before buying any combo VHF/UHF antenna make sure the channels you have locally match the coverage of any combo antenna. For me I was told all my locals would switch to UHF, only to find out after I installed a new UHF, the final implementation of the digital conversion some stayed on VHF.
customer_reviews.author: EasTrader

customer_reviews.title: We increased the number of OTA stations we received from 71 to 92 with this antenna.
customer_reviews.text: We replaced an RCA Yagi damaged by a storm with this antenna. We paired it with a Channel Master amplified splitter and couldn't be more pleased. We are 44 miles from the broadcast towers in Houston and receive all the possible channels both VHF and UHF from that area clearly and without any pixelation. We are also picking up a few channels from the backside of the antenna. We did use a compass to aim our antenna. I recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Hanks

customer_reviews.title: Easy Installation; Money Saver ; amazing reception
customer_reviews.text: Excellent Product ; excellent Seller. Thank you! Antenna is very thin, easy to install and most of all I got quite a few free channels. Saving allot of money I don't have expensive cable, got rid of it. Now I have free TV including PBS (public broadcasting Stations) local news, etc; between the free channels ; you tube and Netflix (only pay 10.+ ) I have everything I need. For Internet I use Century Link, low fee of $45. and I am very satisfied, don't need expensive cable. This antenna is amazing I just love it! Make sure you move it around before you set it to get the best picture quality.
customer_reviews.author: JANE GARCIA

customer_reviews.title: Amazing antenna
customer_reviews.text: I bought this thing to replace rabbit ears and it is almost perfect. I live in the city so I get a lot of channels. Most of my signal cutting out problems are gone. Once in a while with weak channels my picture cuts out for a second or two, but this little jewel really does the job. I have it mounted high in my window with clear tape. Best antenna I ever had.
customer_reviews.author: James Browning

customer_reviews.title: Crystal clear
customer_reviews.text: Even though it says compact, it was a pretty large antenna. The weight is very light. It was easy to attach to the mast from the previous dish and get everything pointed. I am 34 miles away from most of the signals and in a wooded area. Many channels came in that were promised on AntennaWeb. The weather boot to add on the coax was a bit of a pain to attach since the cable outside already had high-end fittings that were a little bulky. Otherwise a great product.
customer_reviews.author: JonL

customer_reviews.title: Worked, decent quality
customer_reviews.text: Worked, pulled in 14 solid stations first time, also about 15 more that aren't exactly clear but become clear if I move the antenna. I pushed It high up on wall and used two push pins to trap it instead of the adhesive tape. White color and cable blend into white wall. Area is mid-eastern Ohio and website said stations were about 20 miles away in a few directions so this is doing as advertised. I purchased two more for another house.
customer_reviews.author: SteveR

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: I got this antenna during a lightning deal period. I think it was about 8 dollars. We had been using rabbit ears on our HDTVs since we had them, and they worked fine, with the exception of 1-2 channels sometimes going in and out. I was hoping that this antenna would be able to keep those channels, since I stuck it directly on our window. While it does look better (nearly invisible, since the wire goes up and behind the curtain/blinds), it does not get better reception. But at that price, I can't really complain. I don't know if a higher-range antenna would be any more reliable...
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Miller

customer_reviews.title: Works but not that reliable
customer_reviews.text: I live in West LA at the foot of the Hollywood Hills and while this does work at pulling in free local channels to my LG Smart TV, it doesn't work all that well. It partly loses the signal sometimes resulting in a blurry picture or loses the signal entirely and I have to re-tune my TV antenna connection. I don't use it much because it just hasn't been very reliable. To be honest I think the old "rabbit ear" antennas were more reliable than this has been.
customer_reviews.author: calitrav

customer_reviews.title: Great if near TV transmitters
customer_reviews.text: I have a friend who always used rabbit ears on his TV. Every time visiting his house to watch a sports event, he spent a lot of time adjusting the the antenna to get a clear picture, which would last about 10 minutes. In desperation, I bought this antenna for him. He left it on the shelf until just before the Super Bowl when he couldn't get a picture at all. He remembered my gift, replaced the rabbit ears and propped the antenna behind a picture on the wall. Perfect picture through the whole game - he was amazed! He lives about 10 miles from the antenna farm on a mountain that transmits almost all TV broadcasts in our area.
customer_reviews.author: Doctor Z

customer_reviews.title: Really works compared to other HDTV antennas
customer_reviews.text: I have tried many other HDTV "cheap" solutions including rabbit ears and other flat antennas. The reviews looked good for this one so I tried it. I have a box where I can see the signal strength in real time. Using the previous small antenna, I saw almost no signal at all. Using this antenna got 3/4 full scale. TV could only find about 33 stations using the old antenna. Found 57 stations with this one (this is in the NYC area). Found the same number using other TV's and a recorder with a digital tuner that i use as my DVR. Can;t recommend highly enough. Will be buying 2 more for the other TV's in the house.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Klein

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT RECEPTION on ALL OTA Channels
customer_reviews.text: I live over an hours drive from the nearest television tower, 45 minutes from "the city". I mounted this on an old Dish Satelite mount (took the dish LNB and Dish off, mounted it to the remaining pole) and pointed it at the city. PERFECT RECEPTION on ALL OTA Channels. This thing is a beast. Cut the cable once and for all, saved myself over $100 a month! These people have a lock on the antenna business, don't buy the cheap crap, get this. You'll thank me after you install it.
customer_reviews.author: USAF99

customer_reviews.title: I bought a compass and lined it up perfect. Now all the stations are error free
customer_reviews.text: So I am about 20 miles from the cluster of TV stations in Dayton,Oh. I had a disc shaped omnidirectional antenna that was almost ok, but the local Air Force Base would cause it to cut out on some channels. So I bought this popular unidirectional antenna, and I looked up online the exact degree that I needed to point this. I bought a compass and lined it up perfect. Now all the stations are error free, and they even seem to be HD now, a lot crisper picture. So now , as long as it stands the test of time, it gets a big thumbs up from me.
customer_reviews.author: AL 66

customer_reviews.title: I ordered this for my mom to hook up an ...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for my mom to hook up an old tube tv in her basement. She doesn't spend a lot of time down there so there was no point in paying for another cable box. This little device, plus a 50 ft coax cable, and this a digital converter box ( and she was able to get the local channels on an old tv for free. And she was able to figure out how to hook it all up by herself! That was the impressive part.
customer_reviews.author: Cat J

customer_reviews.title: My Favorite
customer_reviews.text: Now, THIS is the one to purchase. It works so well that I'm even picking up signals from the next state up and my location is surrounded by mountains and trees. We did put an amplifier in the basement to enhance the signal strength and it did just that. This is worth every cent. You may want to silicone or glue the top and bottom reflectors together before installation. 1byone makes some HITS & MISSES. This one is a HIT. Works exceptionally well. Out of ALL the antennas I've tested, this one REALLY stands out. It made it through 4 tornadoes and a Macroburst. That's saying something!
customer_reviews.author: MBCT

customer_reviews.title: Lives up to its reputation
customer_reviews.text: This is a functional, simple and cost-effective solution for reliable and (thanks to digital) immaculate broadcast reception in my hilly metropolitan area. With zero power consumption and no moving parts, it will outlive me and everyone I know. It replaced a low-quality amplified model from a discount store, and it performs much better: the occasional A/V dropouts have completely disappeared. And it's invisible in the living room, since I ran the cable through a wall and mounted the antenna high on the wall of the adjacent bedroom.
customer_reviews.author: curiosity

customer_reviews.title: Delivers over and above
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful antenna. I use an Amazon fire stick with remote along with the antenba and am able to stream local channels, Amazon apps as well as HD channels. Now I need to stop paying Xfinity for my front tv which is not worth a dime.
customer_reviews.author: C.B. Russell

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good, but not magical either.
customer_reviews.text: The picture is very crisp on channels with greatest signal strength. Not a huge improvement over digital tv rabbit ears, but the cost is great, so it's a wash. Took a while to position it right, and unless it's actually hanging, the cord insertion is rather obtrusive when positioning it (I just turned it sideways though, seems fine). The stand is probably helpful for this-but I'll stick to homemade for that part. We live in urban Phoenix, 20 miles from our towers.
customer_reviews.author: Joey

customer_reviews.title: disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I bought this almost a year ago and it worked ok with my old tv (reception would cut out a lot though). I recently upgraded my TV and i can only get 2 channels vs. the 50 or so before. I have the antenna in the same spot as before. So, i decided to browse this product's reviews here on amazon and am learning about the amplifier? Mine never came to me with an amplifier and that is very disappointing. Especially since I could probably use it with my new TV. I just want to get the ABC channel. :(
customer_reviews.author: Chrissy

customer_reviews.title: I like that this is all black vs black and white ...
customer_reviews.text: For all of you who may have an antenna that does not appear to work........I nearly returned this one because would not work and then I figured this out. IT WILL ONLY WORK IF YOU UNPLUG THE ROKU. IF THE ROKU HDMI CONNECTOR gets within inches of being plugged into the HDMI port in the back of the TV then OUT GOES THE ANTENNA RECEPTION 100%. So you have to have one or the other plugged in and cannot have both plugged in at the same time. I like that this is all black vs black and white like the Mohu and half the cost of the Mohu....of which i have 2 of those too.
customer_reviews.author: KC

customer_reviews.title: Great value and great signal quality
customer_reviews.text: I got this antenna after I quit Xfinity cable. Installation was gas and supper easy I live in a big city and the quality of the signals I got is excellent! I got all nationwide station in a HD quality. Come with antenna connection to the back of the tv (not HDMI) No need for looking for antenna with an amplifier for extra $$
customer_reviews.author: Malkiel

customer_reviews.title: GREAT ANTENNA
customer_reviews.text: Great antenna,easy to install. Live in Phoenix about 15 mi from antenna on south mtn. Told there wre 55 chan there. Used 25 ft good coax..and my last install for a neighbor.....got 81 channels. Have put up 5 of these for friends, and lowest channels are 50. Love it, with my Roku box now have hundreds of. Channels. It is a BUY.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Z. Mazurek

customer_reviews.title: Great product.  Worth the investment.
customer_reviews.text: This is really a great product. The picture quality on my t.v is clear and beautiful. It also gives you plenty of added channels. The only reason why I did not give it 5 stars is that the adhesive it comes with to stick it on the wall or window does not work. Keeps falling off when mounted, I have to use scotch take to keep it in place.
customer_reviews.author: Peh

customer_reviews.title: Poor design and cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: Poorly made and poor design. Was only able to receive 1 digital channel and even that wasn’t reliable. Looks to be cost engineered to hit a price point. I Tried out several indoor antennas and this was the worst performing. Clearstream Eclipse turned out to be the best and was able to receive over 50 channels in my area.
customer_reviews.author: Jwalter

customer_reviews.title: works good for me
customer_reviews.text: I previously tried an amplified antenna which did not work for me. This one has no power and it works better in the bedroom. The room is on the other end of the house from the transmitters. So, there are a couple channels it does not bring in, but can live with it.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnarino

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous
customer_reviews.text: An absolute necessity to cut your cable bill! Simple to hook up to your TV and scan for channels. Be warned that it may take multiple scans with the antenna in different locations to find the best placing to get the most/clearest channels. I used mine in connection with a 50ft extender and stuck it to the window in my bedroom with the TV located in the livingroom. The picture quality is great, but of course depends on your TV. This picks up both UHF and VHF frequencies, so in LA I could get all the locals including ABC, CW, NBC, FOX, CBS, but it does sometimes depend on the weather...
customer_reviews.author: Myanna Widdowson

customer_reviews.title: Very Pleased - Great antennae
customer_reviews.text: I went from 3 of 5 major networks in my area to all of them plus a bunch others. Before switching I couldn't' get the local CBS station, now I get 2 of them. Plus all sorts of random stuff went from 10 to 20+ total stations, not bad for 12$, Very pleased. My only slight complaint is I needed a white antennae because I have it in my window and my homeowners association is crazy. Anyway the 3m stick tape works great but is black. I just used some white double stick tape I already had, but that's not really a complaint, just FYI.
customer_reviews.author: AnonymousGuy

customer_reviews.title: Surprising
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews, still wanted to try this out for our social gathering football games. I tested this in my basement, works like a charm. On gameday, again it worked perfectly. No need to hang it, left it flat on the table. I do live near a major city, so signal shouldn't be an issue. Worth the money for sure!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Buy 2 so you can cover all directions and get the most channels available.
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these since I made the choice to tell the cable company to suck it after they kept jacking up my bill. I also bought a splitter so I could have one antenna facing east/west and one facing north/south I ran my channel scanner on my TV and can watch over 100 channels clearly, I also bout a fire stick so I can watch movies and some other shows that local channels don't cary but even with that I'm still saving over $150.00 a month.
customer_reviews.author: PhantomII

customer_reviews.title: 23 channels received...
customer_reviews.text: Lazy me: I attached this antenna to my battery operated TV* without unwinding the coaxial cable or removing the plastic film, whilst sitting on the couch. I received 23 channels when I scanned for channels. I was approximately 30 feet away from the window, which faces north (Direct TV satellite dish must face south which is why I don't use their service). Granted, I don't live on top of a mountain, nor do I live out in the boonies, but for me, this 25 mile antenna is all I need. Now that I know it works, it can be put away until I need it. (*) Haier HLT71, 7'' DIGITAL LCD TV.
customer_reviews.author: danaeTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Very simple and great quality
customer_reviews.text: I dropped cable! Although I was very nervous about doing so it is proved to be simple and reliable to now have local stations with this antenna. I live about 15 miles from the television antennas from the local news stations and this antenna works great. With this antenna and a fire stick from Amazon there is zero need for cable television anymore.
customer_reviews.author: RBG

customer_reviews.title: Not as good
customer_reviews.text: After a 6 months I went back to my old RCA Compact outdoor antenna. This antenna went up easily and did a pretty good job receiving my OTA channels until some of my channels changed frequencies. They move to channel 19 this antenna did not like that and started pixelating those channels. I switched back to my simple yagi and it all went back to normal. So this antenna might work for you but, in the end it did not work for my frequencies.
customer_reviews.author: C. Rowell

customer_reviews.title: The $50 ge pro antenna from Walmart gets great reception. Just doesn't get Fox
customer_reviews.text: This may work compared to an indoor antenna, or if you live next to the towers. But... It is worthless where I live. 60 miles from towers, in the mountains of PA. On the roof, with a clearstream juice preamp, and an el cheapo amp from Walmart. The $50 ge pro antenna from Walmart gets great reception. Just doesn't get Fox, and I randomly have to adjust 2-3 times a year, so been trying to upgrade. Tired of buying different online $40-$50 weird looking "long range" antennas. Guess I'll live without Fox, because I'm tired of wasting my hard-earned money. And so, so tired of crawling on my roof.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Miller

customer_reviews.title: Nope
customer_reviews.text: This thing is painful. It has to have the most clear path to the tower. It has to be programmed like 3 or 4 times to get any channels.
customer_reviews.author: Annjala

customer_reviews.title: The 16 foot connection cord is a plus and makes installation easy. I installed this antenna in a closet by ...
customer_reviews.text: This antenna appears robust for an indoor installation and works reasonably well. The 16 foot connection cord is a plus and makes installation easy. I installed this antenna in a closet by taping it to an outside wall for good reception. It does receive all the local channels well. It does not receive as many channels as the super home-made coat hanger antenna it replaces, hence the four stars instead of five. But it does provide a much more permanent and unobtrusive installation.
customer_reviews.author: Old Guy

customer_reviews.title: It's nicely made and fairly handsome as far as that goes
customer_reviews.text: This unit is "Just OK". It's nicely made and fairly handsome as far as that goes, but the reception isn't what it was cracked up to be. It is pulling in a station about 80 miles away, but so does literally any other antenna I hook up, so not much special there. It's directional, but it seems to be a modified Yagi design, so sure--it's gonna be somewhat directional. The price is good. And it is easy to put together. Don't expect miracles though.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Rockatansky

customer_reviews.title: If the range was 35 miles then a TV in ...
customer_reviews.text: If the range was 35 miles then a TV in Baltimore should pick up one DC station, which this did not. It picked up more local stations, if in the right place on the wall. My experience with these kind of antennas have been less than stellar, even the ones that are powered with their own plug. It seems to depend more on where on the wall it is placed, what the house is made of and if there is a tree out in front.
customer_reviews.author: Marie

customer_reviews.title: We like the design better than traditional "rabbit ears" because it ...
customer_reviews.text: We like the design better than traditional "rabbit ears" because it is very low-profile; but unless you mount this right next to a window, it still doesn't pick up as well as we expected. For us, there is not a good place near a window and 10' of cable wasn't enough. Also, there is no good way to test a location with this antenna before mounting it (touching it interferes with reception), and the mounting tape included does not remove easily. In fact, we had to move it after mounting, and the tape ripped a 4" chunk of paint off our wall. Overall, we'd recommend this style and brand, but a longer reach than you'd initially consider.
customer_reviews.author: JenBinVA

customer_reviews.title: Not a very good antenna as ordered...
customer_reviews.text: I tried it assembled by the instructions and it didn't work very well at all. Then I took it apart and put the small reflector in front of the larger one, both pointed in the same direction...took the balun/driven element off another antenna and replaced the original which was way out of the plane of the directors and now it's an excellent antenna.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Marsh

customer_reviews.title: Delighted with reception - 53 channels received
customer_reviews.text: Astonished with the excellent quality of the received picture. This is the 35 mile version, no booster. Attached straight to the TV. Autotuned to 53 stations within 2 minutes and 38 were HD. Very impressive for me. Admittedly it seems I am only 15 miles from the transmitters, so for me this may be a little academic, in terms of what I should have expected. Nevertheless...- this is well packaged, well made and a delight to use.
customer_reviews.author: DTee

customer_reviews.title: Not a miracle antenna, just a normal one that looks unobtrusive
customer_reviews.text: This is not a miracle antenna that will suddenly pull in all the channels available over the air. I was able to see about 4 channels of about 16 that are available in my area. All 16 are within the 35 mile range of the antenna. It does work better than rabbit ears but I will buy something that I can actually point in the direction of the broadcast towers and pick up some of the channels I want. Right now, I am using a Winegard antenna that is less than pretty but gets a few more channels from inside the house. This one is going back.
customer_reviews.author: Max

customer_reviews.title: Awesome antenna! Runs 4 TV's with preamp.  Goodbye cable TV!
customer_reviews.text: I have this in my attic pointed to towers about 30 miles away. The materials between the attic and the towers are composite board, a thermal barrier and vinyl siding. It gets great UHF and high-VHF reception. I have over the air tv split to 4 televisions (with a preamplifier purchased separately). It's been six months and I couldn't be more pleased with this product. I had tried a few other antennas and this one is awesome. Goodbye cable TV!
customer_reviews.author: IboughtThis

customer_reviews.title: It worked great first try!
customer_reviews.text: It worked better than expected. I was worried that I was not spending enough and that I might have to mount this in a way that I would be able to turn it for some channels. I saw a neighbors $100 model and simply copied his directional position. I put it on a sliding door window ( second story ) and I got every major channel and many more. I live in NW Las Vegas, so we do have many channels available over the air, but the towers are approximately 26 miles from my house. Every channel is glitch free, except for a few privately owned religious based channels. I couldn't be happier with the result.
customer_reviews.author: AVJGUY

customer_reviews.title: They were great with the exchange
customer_reviews.text: This really didn't work. It might have been due to where I live. I was hoping to get enough channels so I could cut the cable, but no channel came in clear. I ended up only getting a handful of channel, some which were in Spanish and all with a lot of static. They were great with the exchange.
customer_reviews.author: Trenton I.

customer_reviews.title: 2 to 28 channels!
customer_reviews.text: I attaced the attena to my home made 2" galvanized pipe extension (which i added on top of an old satellite receiver eve bracket) and connected it to the exiating satellite cable system. Went from 2 channels to 28 HD and 5 analogue . The reception is better than my satellite and i get more stations than are offered by DTV. The best 40$ investment you can mke. I do have the luxury of living on a ridge top with a line of sight view to the transmitters 35 miles away on a mountain top. So while my situation is optimal, your results may vary from mine.
customer_reviews.author: Smatson

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for us
customer_reviews.text: We dumped our cable and thought we'd try to see how may stations we could pick up with an inexpensive antenna. We were surprised there was so much out there. Anyway, we are satisfied,m especially at this price!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and simple, cut your cable
customer_reviews.text: This is literally saving me at least $500 a year. I know there are cheaper flat antennas out there, but this one has provided a much more consistent experience overall with signal reception and quality. Of course your results will vary depending on geographical factors as well as your walls and windows, but understand that the product is solid and well made, unlike some of the flimsy competitors
customer_reviews.author: T. K. Kendall

customer_reviews.title: Great picture!! Time to cancel cable tv!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent picture!! Able to receive all local basic channels CBS NBC ABC PVS FOX WPIX WOR and some smaller movie, comedy channels. I live in NYC and am impressed with the quality of the picture. Very sharp. Occassionally depending on time of day sometimes the reception is slightly choppy but I think if I put it closer to the window then that should fix it. Easy setup. But this is perfect for someone who's not a couch potato and watches tv occassionally. It's great that I can now cancel my basic cable and save $300 year.
customer_reviews.author: Stellar

customer_reviews.title: it works great in terms of boosting the reception
customer_reviews.text: it works great in terms of boosting the reception. I'm able to recieve all local channels except for one that occasionally has frackles/freezes. I would highly recommend NOT to put this up against the wall with the 3M adhesive that's provided in the package!!! The 3M adhesive is strong but the antenna itself is a lot too heavy. The second day after I put the antenna on the wall, it fell off, now there's a big tear/hole on my dry wall directly above the TV in my living room. Yes, the wall paint isn't strong enough to withstand the weight of the antenna.
customer_reviews.author: Joe X

customer_reviews.title: CUT THE CORD!
customer_reviews.text: Cut the cord! My husband I and realized that we really watched very little cable and decided to go with the digital antenna and some streaming services instead of the cable company that name should not be spoken. Make sure to check your address at antennaweb.org to see what distance you need to purchase. I went about 5 more miles than recommended to get a great signal. On first scan we got over 20 channels. The picture is crystal clear, unless someone starts messing with the antenna. You will need to try it in a few positions and run your "channel scan" to see where you get the best reception.
customer_reviews.author: CLG

customer_reviews.title: ... the first day I got it and it works great. Please note the area you live in as ...
customer_reviews.text: I set up this product the first day I got it and it works great. Please note the area you live in as even the best products may not work well if you are in a location that does not have that many broadcast signals. I live in the Denver area and when I scanned for channels, I got about 55-60 channels. I attached the flat part of the antenna to the upper corner of the nearest window (it comes with adhesives) and works fine. I will say is that you may need to line (keep the cable cord) near the edge of the window and wall all the way to the TV for best signal strength.
customer_reviews.author: Howard

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product at an exceptional price!
customer_reviews.text: I'm amazed by this product. Doesnt feel like there is much build quality but it definately works great. I can get dozens of HD channels. Place in direct line of sight with nearest window and you should be fine.
customer_reviews.author: Arlycern

customer_reviews.title: Great signal about 5 miles from NYC stations
customer_reviews.text: Works very well. I am about 5 miles away from NYC TV stations, in Weehawken, NJ and my window is facing away from the island, so I was not sure if the 35 mile antenna will be sufficient. But despite that I am receiving very good and clean signal from all the major channels, getting about 50 different channels, which is almost all the channels that I am supposed to get based on a website online! I am not using any amplifier, the antenna works as is. I am on the 6th floor, so my height may be helping me, as I am away from many obstacles.
customer_reviews.author: Abhijit Kiran

customer_reviews.title: I was amazed at how good the reception is
customer_reviews.text: I was amazed at how good the reception is. I was somewhat in disbelief at first, because it is a piece of wire running inside a giant square-sized piece of plastic, but when I started getting all the local channels and then some, I was amazed. In Puerto Rico there are not many local channels as in, maybe, some states in the US, but when I started watching BAYWATCH in spanish in the local channel of Telemundo...that's when I realized how powerful this thing is....it brought back the HOFF
customer_reviews.author: David R. Bermudez

customer_reviews.title: This little things is amazing. We have ours on the wall next to ...
customer_reviews.text: This little thing is amazing. We have ours on the wall next to the tv since the cord was not long enough to reach the window. We thought that that would affect it significantly. I couldn't believe that it actually works hung on the wall. We live in a large metropolitan city and get a few local channels and a few really weird ones like comet (never even heard of it) Asian channel, a few Spanish channels and British news!!! Either way, 17 bucks beats paying $$$ for cable every month. We are very happy with it!
customer_reviews.author: Ania Broz-St

customer_reviews.title: The Little Antenna That Could
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant about this, but considering the low price, I figured if it did not work, I could just throw it away; but what a surprise to see how well it works. Other antennas had done a pretty decent job, but my house was built in a strange configuration with a lot of interference, so I had already given into the idea that air antennas would not work. Until I tried this one! Somehow I am picking up about 67 channels, including all the HD channels between 2 (CBS) and 13... I have been able to watch all NFL games in CBS, FOX and NBC in HD! Needless to say, this is wonderful.
customer_reviews.author: Mauricio Cadavid

customer_reviews.title: Really Works
customer_reviews.text: Great Reception, much better then I would have thought from just looking at it. Bought this to replace a pair of rabbit ears that where absolutely worthless. really don't understand how something that appears so simplistic can give you such great reception. I got the 25 mile model whuch is not amplified so you have to play a little with the placement but after a few minutes got all the local stations coming in as clear as a bell, really impressed so much was thinking about buying another one for the bedroom tv. Great value and performance!
customer_reviews.author: T. Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this. I only get one of ...
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this. I only get one of the major channels between CBS, NBC, ABC, Fox, and I live on a mountain near where they broadcast it. I do get some other minor channels but this thing has to be placed inconveniently to even get those. All I wanted was those major four and it doesn't deliver.
customer_reviews.author: I'm right

customer_reviews.title: Looks good, sounds to good to be true
customer_reviews.text: Looks good, sounds to good to be true. So bought it and guess what, applying for refund. Spend hard earned $ on a better product and get an amplifier, it does not work out of the box in a large metropolitan area that should have a reliable signal
customer_reviews.author: Mark  Schuler

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product. I finally decided to cancel cable and ...
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product. I finally decided to cancel cable and took my chance on adding an antenna. The price wasn't bad and I noticed that I was able to return it for free if I had any issues with it. I hooked it up to my plasma tv, placed the antenna on the wall with the help of the adhesive provided and auto programmed my TV. In less than 5 minutes I had the local channels and the Spanish channels for my mother to watch her "Novelas". I was so pleased with the product, I decided to buy a couple more and referred this product to some of my friends that are planning to get rid of cable.
customer_reviews.author: Amzbuyer366

customer_reviews.title: Works Exactly as Expected (Didn't Have Too High of Expectations Though)
customer_reviews.text: Antenna works very well. Had to use our own mounting method to attach to the wall because the double-sided adhesives provided lost their stickiness after moving a few times, though we were also attached to a difficult surface (rough grain of wood). Overall, very satisfied with this product. We live in a rural area about 30 miles from the nearest city where most channels are broadcast from & we receive about 10 channels - but we all purchased this equipment to pick up the few major channels we were missing without cable.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: Great buy for the cost.
customer_reviews.text: Bought two of these. We live in the middle of our cities cluster of TV towers (literally within 3-4 miles of the furthest away one). Picked up 25+ channels on both TV's we hooked them to. GREAT buy for the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Wall

customer_reviews.title: Free Digital HD TV in my home office
customer_reviews.text: Set this up on the TV in my second floor home office and got rid of the cable box. I only get about a dozen channels but they are clear and in HD and are enough for some background noise when working from home. The reception was good even through rain and snow storms.
customer_reviews.author: Ex-ChiefJim

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I sat and asked myself one day- "what type of OTA antenna defines me as a person?" With the ultimate answer being this guy. This isn't your grandpas antenna, construction is definitely on the cheaper side. But in the 6 months I've owned it, I've had no problems. Its held up to a pretty brutal winter with ice storms over 1/2" accumulation, as well as the gusting winds of a tornado alley spring. Antennaweb quoted there were 19 possible channels in my physical location. This antenna picked up 23. I'd say that's a win, and worth the money paid for it.
customer_reviews.author: Terry Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Works well but needs polished edges
customer_reviews.text: this item cane wick and packaged well. It works as stated. No problem with performance. I was a little disappointed in its workmanship quality. It looks like a plastic sheet for the white gloss that want properly trimmed. Although the product works, the extra of a polished edge would have been enough for 5 stars, so I took off 1.
customer_reviews.author: Q

customer_reviews.title: Wow... pleaant surprise.
customer_reviews.text: When I pulled this out of the packaging I thought it was a joke based on its size and sheer thinness. BUT... it worked really well. I was shocked that something that seemed so flimsy could work so well. I guess I'd have to recommend this one.
customer_reviews.author: S. Hildebrand

customer_reviews.title: Packaging was good and easy to get into but safe
customer_reviews.text: Packaging was good and easy to get into but safe. The antenna works alright but the cable is rather short. I'm lucky that my TV is fairly close to my window. I have placed the antenna a few different places. It works alright but it is hard to tell whether the antenna is screwing up or the signal is just bad around me because there are a lot of dishes and antennas. I live in an apartment complex in a busy city. Overall 4/5 because it definitely works and does what it says but you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Quach

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money.
customer_reviews.text: Not inpressed, my $5.99 walmart rabbit ears work better. There's 2 transmitter stations 11 miles from me. My house that sits on a hill in a clear line of sight to the transmitter station, not even a slight pickup. It does work pointed at the other transmitters 2 miles away but a coat hanger would pick then up. Will try to return.
customer_reviews.author: loosewill

customer_reviews.title: one more disapointment
customer_reviews.text: Works fine for a while then in and out. change the direction, scan, different channels: fine for a while then in and out. This is the fourth antenna I have tried in the last year. Every one has been a huge disappointment . I am 80 years old, kind of difficult going up on the roof to keep changing antennas.
customer_reviews.author: Dic

customer_reviews.title: Sister is happy with her free channels
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this antenna for my sister. The reception is fantastic. She lives in a suburban area about 12 - 15 miles from a major city. So far, she hasn't experienced poor quality due to cars driving by, inclement weather, etc. The antenna is positioned in a 2nd floor window. I own an Amazon Basics HD Antenna (which I don't believe are sold anymore), and I gave this one 4 instead of 5 stars because the cable isn't as long and the antenna itself seems rigid. Mine has more flexibility, and therefore was easier to position.
customer_reviews.author: Blaise

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased this brand of antenna 3 times now! It is great...obtains great quality signal even hidden behind the TV. The adhesive that comes with it is also pretty strong. It has yet to fall off from my dry wall. Highly recommend this antenna.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Love this antenna
customer_reviews.text: Love this antenna, my first one failed after a month, but one call to customer service and I got a replacement. Works great even in my basement. Even when hiding it, it still works. Sometimes I do have to turn it a little to get one specific channel, but hey, for the little cost, I can live with it.
customer_reviews.author: HappyCouple

customer_reviews.title: Digital Antennas Have Come a Long Way
customer_reviews.text: I bought this 1byone antenna because of the great reviews and I was not disappointed. It is the first HDTV antenna that works without any setup. It is the size of a piece of typing paper (thicker though, of course) and works even when it is lying flat below the fireplace/TV stand where the DVD player usually goes. All I can say is sweeeeeet!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: M.D. Kunkel

customer_reviews.title: IT REALLY WORKS !!!!
customer_reviews.text: This works! I was able to get 80 plus channels --although the main ones were what I cared about. I am going to order another one now! Update: after playing around with it, i moved it just a bit and was able to get 113 channels. I know that the other channels are not channels I usually watch, but I do get the major channels (except one: ABC). I am so impressed with this product for $12.99 that I have purchased a better version of it and want to see how many more channels I receive by purchasing additional mileage---
customer_reviews.author: Charlie

customer_reviews.title: Great with a caveat!!
customer_reviews.text: Finally cut the cord!! This makes over the air TV watchable. I live in an urban area but the TV towers are scattered in all directions and the weather plays a big part in reception so I chose not to affix to a surface so I can easily move it to the spots I need according to the channel and weather conditions. Do yourself a favor and buy extra cable so you can easily move it around.
customer_reviews.author: B.W.

customer_reviews.title: INSTALLED IN ATTIC
customer_reviews.text: At first I tried the antenna hanging on the wall by the living room tv. I tuned in 5 digital channels.I went in the attic and disconnected the living room tv coaxial from a splitter.And direct connected the living room tv coaxial to the antenna dangling from the rafters.And tuned in 30 digital channels.This antenna works well and should last a long time in the attic. Worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: gerry

customer_reviews.title: Works better than I expected
customer_reviews.text: I have an HDTV I use as a PC monitor that is on the other side of the house from the antenna on my chimney. I bought this hoping to get a few of the local stations and was pleasantly surprised to find all of them when I ran a channel scan. I just tucked the flat antenna between a couple of books on top of a bookcase, stupidly simple installation.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Jessee

customer_reviews.title: Picked Up UHF but No Luck with VHF
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for UHF but couldn't pick up either VHF channel (and the stations are right next to each other). Easy to setup but because I couldn't get two main channels I returned it. I'll be trying an amplified version to see if I can get the VHF channels.
customer_reviews.author: Choose901

customer_reviews.title: This antenna works.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the 25 mile antenna in white, and boy, oh boy, am I ever happy with this purchase. I now have 20 channels in crystal clear definition, compared to the 10 or so fuzzy channels that I used to have with my old rabbit earred antenna. Assembly was quick and painless; I ended up sticking this on my wall, and because both my wall and the product are white, it isn't an eyesore in the slightest.
customer_reviews.author: Linnea

customer_reviews.title: 1byone
customer_reviews.text: Works good. I should have bought the 150 mile range. I live about 40 miles East of the city. Still pick up the local stations. But a buddy of mine lives closer to the interstate and picks up a few extra channels. But over all very good product. Had my cable turned off. Definitely worth buying.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Like the mounting.  Reception is not 35 miles for us
customer_reviews.text: Antenna only picked up one local channel. I had it mounted 7’ high as well and I am on a hill. Update: seller was very responsive to this issue and offered to send a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Chazyz

customer_reviews.title: This Antenna is good if you need it for picking up the local ...
customer_reviews.text: This Antenna is good if you need it for picking up the local stations in your area. If your like me, I hate paying for TV. I needed something that would go into my bedroom, where I could pick up a few stations. I would not recommend this product if you are far away from any TV stations. Overall nice cheap solution for FREE TV. I will say that I would buy this product again if I needed too. I have dropped it several times and it has not broken on me yet. The cord length is great, so I don't have to worry about putting additional cables on it. And I don't have to worry about moving it around.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Pratt Jr & Family

customer_reviews.title: Great Antenna
customer_reviews.text: I really like this antenna! We got around 20 channels using this! The picture is extremely clear and beautiful. We mainly wanted this so we could see our local ABC, NBC, CBS, PBS, and FOX channels, but got so many more. I would definitely recommend this antenna if you don't have cable or satellite service. It was also extremely easy to set up. we plugged it into the cable port on our TV, scanned for the channels, and we were watching crisp, clear TV in a matter of minutes!
customer_reviews.author: Fari

customer_reviews.title: Low quality. Cannot get decent signal. Not worth it even at $10
customer_reviews.text: Last time I ever buy anything from this brand. I could not get any decent signal from this antenna, while the RCA antenna I installed in the attic gives me many crystal clear channels. I simply don't trust reviews from this brands anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Khanh C. Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: This thing is amazing!
customer_reviews.text: I didn't have high hopes that this would work since we live fairly far out in the country but since the company offered such a good warranty if it did not work, there was nothing to lose. It took about a minute to set up, we didn't even put it in the window, just stuck it on the shelf beside the t.v. When it started it's program I was happily surprised when it found a channel....then another one...then another one. I was elated when it finished and showed we had 43 channels!!!! Every single channel comes in crystal clear. Who needs expensive cable!
customer_reviews.author: DJ

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble and apply to wall but it kept falling off wall and was not strong enough to get the tv channels I wanted. Bought two and same experience with both.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: No channels available in my area
customer_reviews.text: We were only able to get a total of 6 channels and only 1 of those channels was local channel 11, which is not a channel that we watch. The other channels were channels like QVC and a Korean channel. We very disappointed with reception also. We returned the product and only received a $5 refund because we had to pay for the return charge of $5.99, which I think is unfair because the product was totally useless for our purposes and we should not have had to pay the return postage.
customer_reviews.author: blank

customer_reviews.title: Great value / 30 seconds to install
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use on our guest bedroom TV as I had previously used on my office TV. It is a great product and works as advertised. Amazingly easy to install and brings in broadcast TV channels beautifully.
customer_reviews.author: Tixon

customer_reviews.title: Great product, and easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this antenna for the TV in my supply room. Initially, I constructed a homemade antenna, which worked okay for the most part. However, I did have to do quite a bit of adjusting at times. This is very easy to install (I did not use the stick pads) and use. Once I plugged the antenna in, I let the TV search for the channels, and voila, several local HD channels were available. Great product and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Dan D

customer_reviews.title: Received Matte finish instead of the Shiny finish as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Stated it was Shiny but I received the MATTE version. Not a big deal but the product I received technically wasn't as advertised so for that I am only giving 2 stars. This product is BARE BONES in that it doesn't come with any other parts like a stand or suction cup or even a clip. It comes with a 1 inch square adhesive tape and that's it. pretty lame if you ask me since there's no way that tape is holding it secure to ANYTHING. There are other antennas that come with a stand or suction cup for the same price and quality. I would not suggest this.
customer_reviews.author: Cantate Domino

customer_reviews.title: Keep looking...
customer_reviews.text: Horrible product. Worked for less than a week. Then just would not connect to my TV. Moved it to another TV and same result. I would ship it back but I tossed the package it arrived in into the recycling bin.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works well in urban environment
customer_reviews.text: I bought this antenna after first trying out a cheaper model that did not pick up all of the major networks, despite the fact that I live in a major city. I have been much happier with this antenna so far. I can pick up all of the major networks in solid HD, though I do occasionally need to play with the antenna while watching NBC. The long cord is a huge plus, as it has allowed me to experiment with different positions to find the best reception.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: Poor performance poor quality. Stay with Mohu. This is half the price and half the number of channels when positioned in the same location!
customer_reviews.author: MM

product_meta.title: TV Antenna - 1byone Thin and Shiny Indoor Hdtv Antenna, Indoor TV Digital HD Antenna 4K HD Freeview Life Local Channels with 16.5 Feet Extra Long High Performance Coaxial Cable
feature_bullets: FREE FOR LIFE - Never Pay Your Cable or Satellite For Television Again! 1byone antenna can pull in all of your local news, weather, sitcoms, kids and sports programs absolutely FREE. Just connect it to your television and let the antenna do all the work.

Longer Cable, Easier Setup – Our included 16.5-foot coaxial cable makes it easy for you to place the antenna in the area with the best reception in your house, and is especially useful for customers whose TV's are not near windows.
FULL HD - 25 Miles range to access from broadcast tower. It delivers full 1080p HD to any digital-ready TV.

WHAT WE CARE - We don't care about any profits or any earns. What we DO care about is customers have happy purchasing experience and will TRUST "1byone" brand after the first use. All we want is happy customers.
BUYER GUARANTEE - We stand behind our antenna 100% with two years warranty. We do offer a 90 day money back guarantee on all new items in order for you to test the suitability in your area.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.9 out of 5 stars2,233 ratings3.9 out of 5 stars
